summary: When the Navy planned to acquire guided missile frigates—a class of small warship—it took steps aimed at delivering these ships faster. For example, to reduce the risk of design and technology problems, it chose to use many technologies that had already been proven on other ships. However, the Navy undercut this approach by starting construction on the first frigate before finishing its design, among other...
title: Navy Frigate: Unstable Design Has Stalled Construction and Compromised Delivery Schedules
